title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 17 September 2015 - XWiki
content:
<MasterPiece> has joined #xwiki  
00:52 <Chuguniy|2> has quit  
01:07 <rrodriguez> has quit  
01:17 <Denis> has quit  
02:27 <MasterPiece> has quit  
03:49 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
04:10 <Denis> has quit  
05:00 <cpe> has quit  
05:00 <cpe\_> has joined #xwiki  
05:01 <cpe\_> is now known as <cpe>  
05:02 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> has joined #xwiki  
05:05 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> there is no xwiki-platform-oldcore.jar in the war package WEB-INF/lib ,why? my version is 7.1  
08:01 <Bugendolf> has quit  
08:09 <\_cjd> has quit  
08:27 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:36 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:45 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> there is no xwiki-platform-oldcore.jar in the war package WEB-INF/lib ,why? my version is 7.1  
08:46 <vmassol> hi xwikiorg\_guest\_2  
08:46 <vmassol> I probably missed the first part of your question, why are you looking for xwiki-platform-oldcore.jar?  
08:47 <Ramona2> has joined #xwiki  
08:53 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
08:53 <Bugendolf> has joined #xwiki  
09:08 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:13 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> hi  
09:13 <woshilapin> has quit  
09:13 <vmassol> see above xwikiorg\_guest\_2  
09:14 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> hi,vmassol. because I have change the class com.xpn.xwiki.web.RegisterAction  
09:15 <Ramona3> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <vmassol> so you have 2 options:  
09:15 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> I want to update the class  
09:15 <Ramona2> has quit  
09:15 <vmassol> 1) you put the modified class in WEB-INF/classes/… as you would normally do in a WAR  
09:16 <vmassol> (anything in there has precedence over the jars)  
09:16 <vmassol> see servlet spec for this  
09:16 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> cool  
09:16 <vmassol> 2) if you need legacy code, you rebuild the platform legacy oldcore module and replace xwiki-platform-legacy-oldcore by the new version  
09:17 <vmassol> 3) you don't need legacy code. You remove xwiki-platform-legacy-oldcore for WEB-INF/lib and replace it with your version of xwiki-platform-oldcore  
09:17 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> thank you very much, vmassol  
09:25 <vmassol> xwikiorg\_guest\_2: see http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/How+to+replace+an+existing+Java+class now :)  
09:27 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
09:34 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> has quit  
09:44 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki

13:34 <tmortagne> does anyone remember if we have some test class dedicated to query integration tests somewhere ?  
13:35 <tmortagne> (sql queries)  
13:35 <vmassol> I know query manager unit tests but that's not what you're looking for I guess  
13:36 <tmortagne> I want tests on real databases  
13:36 <tmortagne> so test running on a XWiki instance like UI tests  
13:36 <vmassol> but dedicated to testing the query manager?  
13:37 <vmassol> AFAIK we don't have those, the only func tests we have are the func UI tests that indirectly test the query manager  
13:37 <tmortagne> queries in general, in my case it's for $xwiki APIs  
13:38 <vmassol> ok so you mean func tests dedicated to storage?  
13:38 <tmortagne> I mean test executed on a real database, won't enter more in details :)  
13:39 <tmortagne> it's just that the goal of those test is to test various queries directly  
13:40 <tmortagne> anyway I we don't have anyhing  
14:18 <vmassol> Enygma`: are you done with http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Proposal/WikivsNestedSpaces ?  
14:19 <Enygma`> 2 minutes, wysiwyg did something I don`t like  
14:22 <Enygma`> vmassol: done, thanks  
14:22 <vmassol> thanks  
14:25 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
14:41 <cjd> has quit  
14:47 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
15:03 <cjd> has quit  
15:11 <OSIMasson> has quit  
15:26 <mflorea> I just noticed that the hierarchy mode setting is documented only in the release notes. I wanted to link the place where I mention it to the documentation. I'm not sure where it should be documented though.  
15:27 <gsmeria> has quit  
15:28 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
15:30 <vmassol> mflorea: I think in 2 places  
15:31 <vmassol> 1) in the Admin config on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Configuration  
15:32 <vmassol> 2) we should add a breadcrumb section on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/DocumentLifecycle IMO  
15:32 <vmassol> hmm not sure for 2), still thinking  
15:32 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/ContentOrganization is possibly a better place  
15:33 <vmassol> I'd just mention that the breadcrumb behavior can be configured on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/ContentOrganization and link to the admin config page  
15:33 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
15:34 <Denis1> has quit  
15:35 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
15:36 <msmeria1> has quit  
15:37 <vmassol> mflorea: see above :)  
15:37 <vmassol> and thanks for doing the doc cleanup that's nice :)  
15:38 <mflorea> I'm not doing clean up, I'm just documented my stuff. I didn't introduce the hierarchyMode though..  
15:38 <vmassol> yep  
15:44 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
15:48 <Signum> has joined #xwiki  
16:15 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki

17:35 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:03 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> has joined #xwiki  
18:04 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> I am using 7.2 m1 and I find that the document tree is sorted by creation date, How can I sort based on the name?  
18:04 <vmassol> xwikiorg\_guest\_0: first you should try to move to 7.2RC1 asap :)  
18:05 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> may I ask why?  
18:05 <vmassol> because in M1 there's 1 :)  
18:05 <vmassol> meaning the first milestone, ie very unstable  
18:05 <vmassol> and since it's 7.2 it's even moe unstable than usually  
18:05 <vmassol> since we introduced Nested Spaces  
18:06 <vmassol> since 7.2RC1 has been released, you'll get a much more stable xwiki by using it  
18:06 <vmassol> but it may not solve your issue  
18:06 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> okay I was waiting for stable 7.2  
18:06 <vmassol> regarding your issue I have no clue  
18:07 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> i need to sort the documents shown in document tree based on docName  
18:07 <vmassol> have you checked the doc?  
18:07 <vmassol> for the tree  
18:08 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Document+Tree+Macro  
18:08 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> yes, in document tree plugin there is no option for sorting like space index  
18:08 <vmassol> ok so it probably doesn't exist  
18:08 <vmassol> next step is to check jira  
18:08 <vmassol> to see if an issue exists on this  
18:09 <vmassol> couldn't find one quickly, you could report an issue IMO  
18:10 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> for sure! thanks!  
18:11 <cjd> has joined #xwiki
